reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

description.narrative: Rwanda - Malaria - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Rwanda - MOH. This program has the following goals: To reduce malaria mortality by 30% of 2015-2016 level by 2020. The objectives of this program are: By 2020, at least 90% of population at risk will be effectively protected with locally appropriate preventative and vector control interventions. By 2020, all malaria cases will be promptly treated in line with national guidelines. By 2020, all health facilities will provide complete reporting so as to strengthen surveillance, monitoring and evaluation, and inform operational research. By 2020, effective program management and coordination will be expanded to all levels including multi-sectorial and regional partnerships. By 2020, 75% of the population will have correct knowledge, behaviours and practices towards malaria prevention and control

title.narrative: Proportion of population protected by IRS within the last 12 months in areas targeted for IRS
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
CM-Other 1: Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
CM - Other 2: Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
CM other-1: Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community in children under 5 years.
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
CM other-2: Percentage of confirmed cases investigated (malaria elimination phase)
Malaria O-1a: Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Malaria O-1b: Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Malaria O-1c: Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
